comment: Foster skipped the first week of lab, simply because he forgot. When he was there, he seemed chill & labs were pretty straightforward. He didn't answer emails, only texts. He graded not one assignment. Then mid semester he skipped with no announcement. Since that week, we never heard from him or got grades. We went through 2 replacements after him.

Didn't show up the first week of lab. He gave very little instruction or explanation of the labs. No structure. Also doesn't use or respond to email, prefers his phone number, but still takes days if he responds. Disappeared mid-semester and now we've had 3 professors and missed 2 labs. Funny guy, but really screwed us over. Idk if he quit.

Prof. Foster is a cool guy, but not a great teacher. He didnt show up to the first lab, and then another one later on. He gives almost zero instruction, rambles a lot, never grades anything, and only responds to texts. We had to get a replacement halfway thru the semester because he stopped showing up. Not even sure if he still works here.

Professor foster is a nice Professor in general. He will open up any work you need if you ask in person. However he does not submit stuff until the last minute. Grades are due and he has still yet to put in the remainder of stuff. He also does not answer emails no matter what you send.

He makes the work/class easy but apparently he doesn't respond to emails. Also was late to our final because he "slept in." A little disorganized and takes forever to submit grades/feedback. I would take him if you want an easy professor but be prepared as stated above.

Professor Foster is obviously far too smart to be teaching (believe he's an actual chemist and teaching is his side job). Lab attendance mandatory. Dropped lowest lab grade. Will reopen missed assignments until the grades are due. Very laid back and understanding. Super funny. Knows what he's talking about. Definitely take this class with him

Chill professor, gave second chances to redo quizzes, lab reports, notebook checks and dropped the lowest quiz and lab. Study though, because otherwise you'll be confused on what to do during the lab and will fail the final.
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Take his class. You won't regret it. He's a really nice and understanding guy. He responses in a reasonable time, and he gives ample opportunity to improve your grade.

His labs are fun and interesting. You can tell that he actually wants his students to succeed because he is understanding and gives students chances to make up for missing assignments. His tests are also really easy and there were really no hard lab reports.
TAKE HIM!!!! Seriously .. you will not be disappointed. He is amazing!

This was my favorite class of the semester (maybe even the year). It was disorganized because of covid, but that was the entire science departments fault, not the professors. Take him. You can turn in things late and retake bad grades if needed.

Very funny professor, but the class was very disorganized. There were no grades put into the gradebook until around halfway through the semester, so it was very difficult to tell how we were doing in the class. The lab's were easy, but there was almost no instruction involved. Most of the problems were due to covid, but it was still not a fun class

If you have the option to take him, please do!! You will not regret it at all. Professor Foster is the most understanding lab teacher ever. He makes learning fun and will help you out any time. The quizzes are challenging, but he will help you out. As long as you put in effort, you should get an A.
He will explain till you get it and help with your assignments. The quizzes, assignments, tests, are pre-made thought so it can sometimes be hard, but he'll help! Really, no reason not to take him.

This guy is a mixture of things but if anything, he cares about your grade. Takes a while to get grades in but is fair on what you get. Do the work and you'll be fine, show up to class and you'll be fine. Occasionally gives extra credit if he thinks an assignment is unfair or questions aren't clear enough.

Mike is a great Professor! He goes above and beyond to help you succeed. If you actually like chemistry i would pick his brain he is very knowledgable and can explain some concepts better than you lecture professor.

I took Mike for 1211, and 1212 labs. He is by the best professor I have taken so far. Great guy, cares about his students. He is very lenient on grading and due dates, but you still have to do the work. He also really cares about students learning the material, and will go out of his way to help every student understand.

Professor Foster is one of the coolest professors I've had so far. Labs are super easy and he is a very lenient grader. Just watch out for sig figs. He really tries to help you understand the material and helps you with anything if you just ask. Don't stress about his class worry about lecture.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: Not sure how to rate this professor. I would say don't try too hard because you will regret in the end. Foster is the most laidback prof. and he talks as if he is a student. I love his stories, but I don't like the way he grades. It took him forever to grade lab reports. He curved the final. Overall, he is pretty nice guy, but often disorganized.

Foster is the Man. You can enjoy doing all the experiments without having a professor yell at you for small errors. Don't have to go through all the bs that other lab sections do. Easy A is you turn in your work. He is very willing to work with you if you have a problem.
Best lab professor. Really chill but gets work done. There's no way to fail this class.
Michael was super chill, doesn't make you go crazy in your lab notebook. Super understanding, and cracks jokes. Dude was awesome and is the best Lab professor you can get. Try to get him at all cost.

Professor Foster is very laid back and friendly person. He doesn't act like a professor and is very approachable. You get perfect scores on SDS and lab notebook as long as you complete them. He is pretty lenient on lab grading as well.

Foster is AMAZING! Very laid back and nice guy. Always ready to help and likes to have conversations with students. Has reasonable expectations for students and is really funny. No lab tests but there is a standardized final so be prepared for that. Such a great guy, the late time is totally worth it. Easy lab.
Foster is a super easy going professor and he cares a lot about his students. His pre lab lectures arent too long, and overall, great guy!

I feel like three tags isn't enough for this man. Michael is just an absolutely wonderful person. He is extremely helpful when you need it and can be a very easy grader. He told me, "You catch more flies with honey rather than poison," and his teaching style reflects that. If you have the chance, take his class. You will not regret it one bit.10/10

Professor Foster is the nicest professor I've ever met. He really cares about how you do and if you talk to him and put effort into the class he notices and takes a liking to you. At the end of the semester he will let you correct labs to help bump your grade up. He is very willing and ready to help whenever. Definitely take him!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: If you are taking Chem 1211L TAKE HIS CLASS! Hes the most laid back professor ever. He cares about his students and if you dont understand something he will be more than happy to help you out. Im terrible at chemistry and i ended his class with an A! Take him hes my favorite professor ever.
Loved foster- really good at explaining material.

Literally do not take anyone else. Mr. Foster is the best lab professor you will ever have, so dont pass up on the opportunity. He answers any questions you have, and doesnt even enforce lab safety and stuff like that. Whole lot of fun and jokes around with you and is a complete genius. I made an A and i would retake it just to have him again.

Mr. Foster is wonderful. ANY question you have he will answer and help make sure you truly understand. Stay after class and he will help you with anything you need. He is hilarious and jokes around a lot. He will give you chances to redo some labs to get some points back, do it. If he had a lecture I would take him for that as well. He is awesome.

Cool guy, and is very easy on the class overall. Doesn't take himself too seriously, which is a nice break from the standard fare among professors. If he's still available for lab, you should take him.
Great professor. If he had a lecture I would definitely take him. He is very understanding and cares about your grade. 10/10 take this guy.
